meanings.definition: To take up and use as one's own
meanings.sent1: She adopted a stray kitten and gave it a loving home.
meanings.sent2: The company adopted a new policy to improve employee satisfaction.
meanings.sent3: The idea of adopting a healthier lifestyle seemed daunting at first.
meanings.sent4: He adopted a new way of thinking that changed his perspective on life.
meanings.sent5: The artist adopted a unique technique that set her paintings apart.

meanings.definition: To choose or take as one's own child
meanings.sent1: The couple decided to adopt a baby from an orphanage.
meanings.sent2: Many families choose to adopt children from different countries.
meanings.sent3: The idea of adopting a puppy instead of a child crossed their minds.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had adopted a new role when she became a mentor.
meanings.sent5: The team adopted a new strategy to tackle the project more effectively.

meanings.definition: Embraced or accepted as one's own
meanings.sent1: The adopted idea received positive feedback from the team.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sense of belonging after being part of the adopted community.
meanings.sent3: The adopted tradition brought joy and unity to the family.
meanings.sent4: The adopted style of music resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The adopted approach proved to be successful in the long run.
